 You're missing the point. The Federal government MUST be downsized before any other activities can take place. That means that programs that SHOULD be handled by the State/County/City must be gotten out of Washington first.
 For example, Education has no business being funded by Washington. It is outside of their jurisdiction, so to speak. Education is a Local school district/City/County/State function. We have to eliminate Washington's programs before we can revamp the L/C/C/S functions. Since Washington is inherently ineffecient and funding isn't allocated back in the same proportion as it was collected, there will be some pain on the L/C/C/S levels until all of it is out of Washington cmpletely.
 For example, states like MI pay huge amounts of money to Washington earmarked for education, but only a small fraction of what was sent is returned. The rest is either eaten up in administration costs or sent to "more needy" states.
 We need to institute L/C/C/S school taxing policies that eliminate Washington from participation in those programs and alow states to keep money raised in state for education to be kept in state for education.
 The only place in the Free World where there is a "free lunch" is in Washington where politicians have no problem giving your hard-earned money to some other state that they deem "more needy" than yours. emoticon_angry
